page.title: 15LIFE IN ST.KEVERNE 50 Y. AGO
page.content: { LIFE IN St.KEVERNE 50 YEARS AGO Life in St. Keverne 50 years ago was hard because we had no electricity or gas only oil lamps and candles. We cooked on old Cornish ranges. We had a council estate but not as many houses as today. Transport was by motor buses, horseback and 'shanks pony'. There was no tourist industry like today. People were employed on farms, fishing and the quarries. Everyone went to church or chapel and we entertained ourselves by sewing, rug making, fret work and singing. We had no mains water. Where the bus shelter is now was a well from which we drew our water. We had one doctor but not a health centre. There was only one school building which we went to until we were 14. Life was harder and we were poorer but we were happy.
